translations: adj.开明的；文明的；有知识的；觉悟的
v.启迪；解释；照亮（enlighten 的过去式和过去分词）

phrs.translation: 醍醐灌顶, 开明的, 文明的, 顿悟人生
启明, 启示者, 智慧启蒙, 觉醒
开明管理, 开明的管理
开明自利, 开明的自利, 有识见的私利观, 自身利益

sentences.sentence: They have in common only one thing that they tend to annoy or threaten those who regard themselves as more enlightened expenses.
sentences.translation: 它们只有一个共同点，那就是它们往往会惹恼或威胁那些自认为更开明的人。

sentences.sentence: Even if there is no concrete benefit paid in response to your good deed, at the very least, the doer of the good deed has the opportunity to enjoy a kind of spiritually enlightened moment.
sentences.translation: 即使你的善行没有带来任何具体的回报，至少行善的人有机会享受一种精神上的启迪。

sentences.sentence: War of aggression launched by fascists has brought scourges to mankind but also enlightened people throughout the world.
sentences.translation: 法西斯发动的侵略战争给人类带来了浩劫，也教育了世界人民。
